REVIEW_BODY:
Plaza Singapura has a wide variety of shops catering to the middle class. They do not have the signature branded shops as compared to the other malls along Orchard Road.

It is also connected to the Dhoby Ghuat MRT station, which is a major interchange, thus resulting in many customers.

REVIEW_TITLE: One of the Bigger Malls in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: Massive Mall great location is connected to Dhoby Ghaut MRT. Loads of restaurants and fast food chains great food court this mall gets a lot of foot traffic gets really busy during the peak hours. There is a cinema and an arcade here all in all fun place to go with kids.

The Plaza Singapura is 5 floor mall nicely connected with Dhoby Ghaut mrt interchange. 50% of the mall are restaurant and cafe, a lot that we familiar with. So if you a foodie, this is the place for you.
Has everything you need, from M&S through to grocery's and every fashion outlet and direct access to the Dhoby Ghaut MRT

REVIEW_TITLE: Among the worst Car Parks, Good shops and restaurants
REVIEW_BODY: The restaurant and shops are really good, I always enjoy my time at Plaza Singapura, but when I go there it takes a lot of time for me to get a car park space and it is very narrow to go in. I would have scratch my car if I lost just a bit of focus.

We came here for shopping and there are many clothing shops here. The variety of shops are rather limited and lacks signature brands here as compared to the other malls on Orchard Road.

It is easy to get here as it is in front of Dhoby Ghuat MRT station.

The new extension Atrium Center also has quite a lot of shops and dining outlets.

Pros:

1) near to orchid road , best location

2) there is a time zone , (arcade games arena ) , which is little rare in most of singapore malls ,

3) Cinemas are great

4) good for mid-range shopping also , lots of sales when i visited in DEC m,

Cons :

Not really, i didn't find any

I like this mall because it feels very humble. You can shop your daily needs here. They have almost everything you need. Quick cheap food court class lunch, check. Need a quick 10 dollar haircut, check. Looking for 2 dollar shop, check. Watch movie, check. Go to your bank, check. Lego store, check. Fix your phone, check. Check.

Although Singapore has a LOT of Malls, this is a good one to go to. Very convenient next to Dhoby Ghaut station. We use this a lot when in Singapore.
The layout can be a bit confusing. There is a nice food court on the fourth level, but a bit confusing to get to. There is a whole other section that you can get to via the upper floors.
Nice eateries and shopping. The whole family loved it

This mall has been around for many years but it has undergone renovations during the recent years. There are lots of different kinds of shops and food outlets here. The cinema on the top floor is huge too.

It is still very popular and busy after all these years.

It's an excellent plesant compact shopping mall, clean and not too crowded. It serves all types of food and most necessities could be bought there, even baby swimming accessories. Most shoppers are courteous and polite. Food court is located at the 6th floor while plenty eateries spread around at different floors, particularly at 3rd floor, B1 and B2, one can find good varieties of restaurants serving good tasty food at reasonable pricing. Dhoby Ghaut MRT station is located underground.

Getting parking here can be a pain especially on weekends. This place is usually very busy given that it at a train station. It has a coming and It has a supermarket as well as your usual offering of restaurants etc.

REVIEW_TITLE: Big mall with alot of eateries
REVIEW_BODY: Parking on weekend may not be easy. We parked at the atrium on sunday. Crowd was there but still can walk around. Toilets are clean, with diaper changing rooms. We had our snack there as the kids napped in strollers. Nice place to hide from the heat.
This is a place if you want a good variety of shops and eating places in air conditioned comfort. You can access Dhoby Ghaut MRT station from within the centre. My grandsons loved the Comic bookshop.

There are many shops here offering a wide range of popular goods and services. Many F&B outlets as well ranging from food and snack stalls to fast food and better known restaurants like Tim Ho Wan which is rather over-rated in my opinion.

Spotlight occupies a big space offering household goods, arts and crafts materials, party ware etc. There is also a cineplex, a big Daiso and the over-priced supermarket called Cold Storage.

This is a brilliant neighborhood mall.
the mall is just like any other modern mall.. only the layout is much easier to understand .. all straugh and clean..
A mix varieties of shops available here. Typically, can get anything here. Nice to walk about. Clean and spacious environment.
As we stayed near Dhoby Ghaut MRT Station several times, we made Plaza Singapura as our meeting point as a family. Here we could get dinner or lunch with quite many options to choose.

The location of this shopping mall is excellent as it has got good connectivity through MRT as well as Bus. You have options for both Adults and Children in the mall. The food court is quite spacious and has plenty of options. It's worth visiting if you are around Orchard Road or at Dhoby Ghaut MRT station.

Located above one of the big singapore mrt stations this shopping mall has just about what every other shopping mall has in singapore. Watch a movie or eat. Your choices ... well they end with that pretty much.

REVIEW_TITLE: Big mall across Dhoby Ghout MRT
REVIEW_BODY: This is a very big mall which is connected to the Dhoby Ghout MRT station, and it is near the famous Orchard Road. There are lots of stores and dining options. There is also a cinema at the top floor. When I stayed in nearby hotel such as YMCA and YWCA, I always go here to buy things and to eat.
The way they built this mall is very confusing. But Mall size is big. On first floor you can find all brands. Food court is so so. Mostly you will find local foods.

This shopping mall located along Orchard Road has seven floors of retail outlets. An amazing range of products can be found here with a food court on the 4th floor, a supermarket on the lower basement and lots of restaurants and cafes. The amount of food options is mind boggling. Definitely a must visit.

This mall got a lot of stores to shop and dine as well. They have a huge variety of stores to choose from. Most of the stores are the mid-range types. Dining is not a problem in this mall as there are a lot to choose from. Different cuisines and snacks to choose from. Food court is available on the 4th floor. There are as well fast food chains available at B1. Those restaurants are found in the new wing. The only missing thing in this mall is a good department store. It also have cinemas at the top floor. Groceries is available at B2. Toy store would be found on the new wing. This mall is just on top of Dhoby Ghaut MRT station it is very easy to access.

Me and my wife together with our 4 years old grandson, Jonah had lunch at the Sakae Teppanyaki Restaurant located at Plaza Singapura.

We ordered a Salmon and a Beef Teppnayaki Set with Garlic Rice, Tofu with Teriyaki Sauce & Root Beef. We sat at the table watching the Chef cooking the set meal step by step before it was served straight from the hot plate table top to our dining plate - the food was fresh and piping hot and taste very delicious.

We enjoyed our meal at Sakae Teppanyaki.

It's really consider very big mall consisting of 2 towers and the second one having 7 floor with many shops ,cafe and restaurants the 7th floor having golden village cinema plus electronics games Sure you will enjoy here with many options under one roof

REVIEW_TITLE: Mall situated besides SMRT Dhobby Ghaut.
REVIEW_BODY: A bit crowded mall with not much big brands. Just next to SMRT. H&M has a big store there. Food court is crowded and serves local food and Asian as well.
They have a lot of really nice shows.It is one of the many cinemas in that area.Great popcorn,too!Worth a visit.

REVIEW_TITLE: The mall that brought me memories
REVIEW_BODY: Plaza Singapura is a mall that brought me back to the past with many good memories. It has been a few years since i came to the this mall and it has undergone a huge change with new shops and the shops i came to know of no longer existed. Nevertheless, it is still the same old building. Nice place to shop, dine and walk around on a weekend. However, with the centralized MRT station, it is very packed and queues everywhere.

I've visited Singapore for many times and Singapura Plaza is always on top of my shopping mall lists. It is because:

1. There are at least 3 shops selling toys, figures in the mall. I love watching all Batman figures there.

2. Reasonable prices for clothes. Lots of shops offer promotions that will fit your budget.

That's it. Go there now. You won't regret it.

Went to the Golden Village to see a movie. looks like some remodeling is going on. Nice because it has a MRT station. Several stores and places to eat. When we are there we usually stop at Cold Storage because they have fresh baked rolls which is a hard find in Singapore
We went here on our first day in Singapore. It was the first shopping centre we went to not having been to Singapore before. There were around 7 floors, with a large variety of stores and food.

Shopping Centre with endless shops. Multiple levels of shops including an impressive cinema at the top level with tickets around $12, and a supermarket on the bottom level, some metres below from the top.

It's refreshing to see a mall with large open atriums in singapore which otherwise utilises each and every corner of space they have. It houses one of the MRT stations of Orchard road and hence is very accessible. Nice shops to shopping and some nice dining options as well.
Vibrant place with everything you need or like Excellent restaurants, food court, shops, massage places and beauty salons. Even fun sport or musical events
A shopping mall that has not fail to please years after years! It is easy reached by both bus and MRT. Many restaurants, fast food, and food court. This time we had lunch at BangkokJam at Level 3!

REVIEW_TITLE: Close to our hotel and with many eateries
REVIEW_BODY: Plaza Singapura was close to our hotel, the Concorde on Orchard Road, and next to the Dhobi Ghaut Metro station. It turned out that this shopping center could be proud of an untold amount of eateries, so for food it was a no- brainer. Plaza Singapura is one of the oldest shopping malls, but it has been kept up-to-date and in good repair. Plaza Singapura is an interesting shopping mall, has something for everyone and can be recommended, surely when you are hungry or thirsty.

An impressive shopping mall, where you can find lots of food stalls with a variety of food. We decide to have Chinese dinner which is quite tasty and we pay 15 S$. There are crowds of people, it's very hot and noisy here.

REVIEW_TITLE: Lots of food outlets and choices
REVIEW_BODY: One of the famous hangouts for the young n trendy. Just next to Dhoby Ghaut mrt. Very crowded. Lots of shops and outlets. With some huge Many varieties of food too. Nice place to visit. Can spend a day here.

REVIEW_TITLE: “AN EXAMPLE OF SINGAPORE’S Feedback Web results PROSPERITY
REVIEW_BODY: I last visited this Shopping Mall more than 20 years ago. On this return visit the mall has changed and got larger. This mall is used mainly by local people, but here you can find all types of goods, food and services.

This mall is very popular with locals - families as well as youngsters- as it has many stores that sell all kinds of products for day-to-day use (eg. Spotlight, Challenger, etc), a Yamaha music school, telco service centres, an old but huge Golden Village multiplex cinema, and tons of mid-range eateries. The feeling is kind of chaotic (same with the parking garage!), but perhaps the escalators are designed to promote window-shopping.

Linked to Dhoby Ghaut mrt. Plaza Singapura is very crowded and often chaotic. There are restaurants all around but no large food court. If you're lucky, you could find fests and special events in the central area on level 1.

It's rather odd to describe this shopping mall. It's crowded and seemed popular among locals but it does not provide you the convenience as other malls around Orchard. It's just a lack of charm to be among the best. The travellator gave a feel of obstacle for human traffic despite it's an expensive addition to the mall. It slows down those who do not require it. Design of escalator was meant to maximise coverage by shopper so you may hate to travel longer than required most of the time during shopping.
If you are on foot, the location of this mall is far away from adjacent malls so you may decide to skip it. Instead, it's far more interesting to go towards Orchard station for most options for shopping or sightseeing.

REVIEW_TITLE: Great place for hot toy lover
REVIEW_BODY: Go to the top floor of this plaza and you can find many toy shop that sell many hot toys and other interesting stuff. Surely will come back again next time.

REVIEW_TITLE: Nice selection of food and shopping
REVIEW_BODY: We found a fantastic bakery here, as well as some other nice restaurants. We visited many times and always found something new to do. It's conveniently located by the Dhoby Ghaut MRT.
went to the Plaza to look for work clothes. A three level shopping mall. Cannot miss any item you are looking for including food courts. Just a cool place to get lost among the shops

REVIEW_TITLE: Still an enjoyable mall over the decades
REVIEW_BODY: I have been going to Plaza Singapura since I was a teenager. I am impressed by how this old mall post-rejuvenation has been able to hold its own despite the many new malls coming up in Singapore. I love the F&B options with many ranges, with the cheaper options being at basement 3, and mid-range options at the many restaurants. The location makes it extremely accessible by Dhoby Ghaut MRT interchange and bus. I come here for my weekly massage too. The Golden Village movie cinema is always a hit with young and old as well. I highly recommend this mall! Tip: if the parking is full at the Plaza Singapura main multistory car park, consider parking at the atrium wing which includes free valet service (please generously tip the helpful gentleman though).

REVIEW_TITLE: Easy access by MRT or bus
REVIEW_BODY: I went here to watch movie at top-most floor. A bit crowded but it was fun. There was a booth selling Irvins Salted Egg Fish Skin. Very well recommended!
Went here to have a pair of glasses repaired and stayed for dinner. Large mall with many shops and eating options. Central location with easy access by MRT or bus.
In the beginning of Orchard Road that is full of malls. It's not the best mall, but plenty of shops and easy to access. Also food options are plenty.

REVIEW_TITLE: Handy when staying at a nearby hotel
REVIEW_BODY: Cold storage on B2 sells takeaway alcohol which is very handy if staying at the nearby hotels. They also have a popbar which is a neat way to eat gelato

REVIEW_TITLE: Brunch Dinner and Retail Therapy a Must
REVIEW_BODY: You gotta visit Plaza Singapura. A very convenient place to get to where the subway is located below. Great food and lots of shopping👍👍👍😁

Plaza singapura is located along orchard road singapore is well connected by public transport systems. It's a biggest transit metro station in singapore. The mall is spread over 7 floors which include two basement floors. Almost all big brands are having an outlet there. Lots of eateries are available there making our trip to this place a feast for mind and tummy. Don't miss this location once you are in singapore

This was one of a number of shopping malls located along Orchard Road which we visited during our most recent stay in Singapore.
It is large and offers a good variety of fashion and specialty retail outlets for the dedicated shopper. However, we found it difficult to get very excited about this shopping mall. It appeared to be a bit tired and in need of some rejuvenation.
The most positive thing that can be said about this mall is that it is well served by public transport. There is a rapid transit railway station located immediately below it and public buses run by it, along Orchard Road.
However there are other much better shopping malls located elsewhere along Orchard Road.

REVIEW_TITLE: Quite big but not ideal for shop&eat
REVIEW_BODY:
We went here because i wanted to find seiko watch for friend. Difficult fo find nice restaurant that have gluten free & vegetarian option.
But i found very interesting store which is build a bear workshop i got new pinky teddy bear at the end. Too bad i couldnt build my own teddy bear. The sales girl didnt allow me to do it
If i would come back to this mall,it definitely because of that workshop
Great mall that has a good spread of retail stores, foodcourt and many F&B outlets. There is a theatre to catch some movies if bored. The Dhoby Ghaut station has 3 lines and is just below the mall.

Good thing about this mall is that it has a good spread of retail shops, coupled with a good size foodcourt and many F&B. Also has a Golden Village cinema inside. The MRT Dhoby Ghaut station is right next to this mall as well.

We have spent time in Singapore before but had not previously visited this shopping mall. This time we went to go to a couple of specific shops. We did not have time to check out the whole mall on this trip, but will return next time we are in Singapore to take a closer look at more of it. What we saw impressed us. It is a decent size, with a good variety of shops, better than some of the other malls.

REVIEW_TITLE: One of the more useful malls in Singapore.
REVIEW_BODY: Most of the malls in the Orchard Road area are full of designer shops, selling mainly clothes and jewellery. Plaza Singapura is a much more useful mall located easily fro Dhoby Ghaut MRT station. You will find a good selection of eateries plus a good supermarket, and shops selling more useful items, such as reasonably priced shoes and clothes as well as an excellent Japanese $2 store!

This place goes on forever! Packed with the usual stores as well as the unusual stores selling gaming, animated characters, coz play costumes and gift shops of every type. Build a teddy, paint a picture, music shops or just stop in the vast food hall for dinner! Something for everyone!
Awful- no other words! Looked good but had absolutely zero flavour. Fried glass noodles- blah and seafood hor fun- well 1 prawn! Even came with seaweed water soup! Avoid!!!!
An old style singaporean malls that now under renovation for renewal. A little bit mess but still sensing the old and memorial plaza of Singapore. This is Plaza Singapura! You should come..

Location may be the greatest thing about Plaza Singapura, right next to Dhoby Ghaut MRT station. Other things about it were just average. Stores were not as great as at other malls in the same area. Food court was good but not excellent.

Was a nice visit. Very good food area and late night you can find eating available at the basement floor in Mcdonalds and KFC. SMRT for Dhobi Ghaut is attached to the mall.
Outside the mall is a nice place to relax and watch the world go by.
I go for this mall to visit spotlight shops to get materials for my wife's handicraft work.. This mall is 6 storied has a GV or Cathay theatre (do not remember which one) at level 6

Spent a lot of time in this mall. Lots of food stall and different malls on different products. The Japanese shop Daiso where one can buy each item for two dollars is also located. There are sitting arrangements outside under trees. That is smoker's paradise. MRT is under the building. Very conveniently located next to Dhobi Gaut MRT. Lots of good restaurants in the mall. The cinema complex also runs good movies.

A nice mall with all sorts of shops, low, medium and high end.
Type of shops vary from garments, toys, electronics etc.
Food also has great variety from burger king, mc donalds, kfc, to local cuisine shops.
A great place to while away time.
easy access to bus and MRT.

The Cold Storage supermarket in this mall has the largest variety of stuffs. Many wines, liquors, and imported (European) ice creams are available there. The mall is very accessible, as it's connected to Dhoby Ghaut MRT station. Lots of good food and restaurants inside, especially in the new wing. Expect the food court to get very crowded on weekdays lunch & dinner time though.
Interesting mall to visit. Lots of shopping and food/coffee possibilities. Busy during dinner/lunch times and quiet after 7-8PM.

The MRT arrives in the lower level and there are many smaller shops here and not just the big brand names. Always fun to shop at the Diasio (Japanese version of Dollar store) and there is a cineplex too.

This mask is more for daily needs of someone who lives in Singapore than a tourist looking for hip and avante garde shopping. Was a little surprised that a lot of stores were still closed all past 11 am when the signs said 10 am.

One of the bigger malls in Singapore with tons and tons of eateries. From the wallet friendly outlets to the famous Hai di Lao, can find lots of cuisine here. At the top level, there is a food court and also a cinema. Just that it may be problematic to actually find parking lots.

Plaza Singapura is a contemporary shopping mall located on Singapore’s shopping street, Orchard Road. Plaza Singapura was completed in 1974 and it is one of the oldest malls located along Orchard Road and it was one of the largest shopping malls in Singapore and South East Asia. It is seven floors high and it has 3 courtyards. It is also connected to the retail podium of The Atrium@Orchard via internal walkways on levels 1, 3 and 4. The mall have so many amenities like baby nursing rooms, paid carpark, and about 130 restaurants. The main store in the mall is Yaohan department store. In this mall you can find book store, children’s store, dept. stores, home furnishing, supermarket, apparel stores, banks, electronics stores, spas, ATMs, pharmacy, flower store and movie theatre. Here you can find plugs and voltage converters (adapters) that fit Singapore electric outlets.

Fabric shoppers paradise. Spotlights appear to have a few shops. A craft shop for stampers, party stuff, cardakers etc.
They also have a small shop for those who want to order curtains.
But wow the fabric and yarn shop is huge! Roll upon roll of fabric with jelly rolls and fat quarters.
There are lots and lots of deals on but many of them are for members only eg batik fat quarters are S$7.99 each or 10 for S$30 if you are a member. It's free to be one just fill in a form and get your membership card. Each time you buy something they scan your card.
Easy to pay by UK credit card, they swipe it and you put your pin number in.
I also got 2 jelly rolls of batiks, 20 in a roll, for S$15 for the two.
A lot of the signs for the deals are misleading - most people wouldn't know many are for members only and the others say eg 40percent off the fabric. A few signs say 40percent off if you buy 4 yards or more. Some is $30/yard.
There is a similar deal on some of the ribbons ranging up to $18 a yard. So you have to buy 4 yards of any to get 50percent off.
I also bought a remnant, 1 metre (they appear to use both yards and metres) at 60% off.
To pay or have your fabric cut you press a button for a numbered ticket and then wait a few minutes for your turn. It seems much fairer that way.
I spent hours in Spotlight and could have spent a lot more time here but I thought it polite to get back to the family.
It's easy to find a toilet as they are well sign posted. So is the taxi rank. The buses stop outside and the metro is either in the basement of the building or over the road.
I honestly think a person interested in sewing fabric, notions, yarn, or similar could spend a day here popping out for lunch or the toilets when needed!

REVIEW_TITLE: Variety of foods and spacious car park
REVIEW_BODY: Enjoy the layout of this mall, easy access via MRT , Car and bus. I drove there and the car Park is quite spacious.

A large mid end mall that almost doubled in size with a new extension a few years ago. The orginal building has the cineplex, supermarket and shops. The new extension has notable additions like a tim ho wan and giant starbucks

Came here for the starhub store for an errand and dropped by for breakfast also. Had a major renovation 5 years ago and added tim ho wan. The cineplex and supermarket are long term anchors. Not a luxury mall

i really enjoyed my time here, lots of affordable shop specially on the top floor theres many toy stores and they sell lot of item such as funko pop and hot toys.
Also on the lower floor they have food court and i really like the noodle there

Plaza Singapura is a very big mall and recent years they have an extension. There are many varieties of shops with F&B outlets especially in the basement and the food court area. There is a cinema on the very top floor as well, for people visiting the Orchard Road area, it is good to visit as the mall have everything in one roof.
so many doors for vizitors 7 floor and many shoops and very good food area big cinema saloon you must vizit
This is a pretty big mall with plenty of shops and eateries. This is also the place where I'll get my camera stuff. Easily accessible by train as there's a link from the mrt station to the mall.

This mall caters for everyday shopping. 7 above and 2 below ground levels with plenty of dining options. Easy access to MRT and situated at the start of Orchard Rd.

Top level has a cinema chain and lower Basement has a large Cold Storage store for all your needs. Not too crowded and a good option for when the weather is inclement.

Operational over 40 years with few revamps, renovations & facelift, this mall is located on the famous Orchard road & is near to Istana in the centrally located commercial hub of Singapore. It is a huge place with equally big multi-floor car park.
One can reach this mall easily by public transport both by train as well as over 20 bus routes. It is just above Dhoby Ghaut station which is an interchange station of original North-South line, later added North-East line & most recent Circle line.
Food outlets are located at almost every level. There are several anchor tenants & famous brand stores. The top floor has Golden Village cinema & toy store, movie replica as well as Time Zone & a corner with rental massage chairs if you feel tired of walking around. A floor below has excellent musical instrument outlet by Yamaha. 5th floor is mainly dedicated to Daiso department store & several home furnishing outlets. My visit was mainly to buy few photography accessories from level 4 based T K Photo Technic which was not found in the recent Comex IT show.
If you visit, do take a look at the glassy & colorful polyurethane sculpture of an Italian artist titled ‘Jelly Baby Family’ at the entrance.

Typical Singapore mall. Lots of high end outlets and the odd restaurant.

One shop that sets this mall apart from others is Spotlight - the art and handicrafts store - diversity unrivalled in Singapore. Great selection there. The bedding shop on the floor below spotlight also has a great selection of bedding and helpful staff.

Worth a look.

One of my favourite malls in Singapore. Plaza Singapura is located at the eastern end of Orchard Road, Singapore’s famous shopping strip. Easily reached by bus and MRT, the mall sits atop of Dhoby Ghaut MRT station. Escalators from the platforms take you to the basement floor of the mall, but if you’ve never been before make sure to read the signs carefully as Dhoby Ghaut is a major interchange for three MRT lines, North South Line (red), North East Line (purple) and Circle Line (yellow). I usually come from Bras Basah on the Circle Line, a one station hop to the terminus and a short escalator ride to the entrance of the food court on the basement floor. Still using the MRT it’s easily reachable from other touristy areas of Singapore: Chinatown, Clarke Quay, Little India and the western end of Orchard Road. The multi-level shopping mall has a large central atrium with escalators on each end. Lifts are also available for the elderly, disable and families. You’ll find all manner of retail shops, from clothing, shoes, homewares, to luggage, art and craft, etc. Cafes and restaurants are also plentiful. On the top floor there’s an entertainment area with arcade games and a cinema. Back on the ground floor in the middle of the atrium, a street style market sets up every day with tables of clothes, shoes, cosmetics, small electrical gear, phone accessories, etc. Vendors change day by day. If you are a collector of figurines and movie replicas I recommend this mall. Several shops are scattered on lower floors, the majority on the top 7th floor. Plaza Singapura is also connected to The Atrium at Orchard via internal walkways on levels 1, 3 and 4. A great place to shop and start your journey up Orchard Road.

Since it's near my office. I'm here for business lunch, get a hair cut, or buy some groceries. Like any mall in Singapore, it has a cinema, a supermarket, and all the range of shops and restaurants. Unique here are spotlight a fabric and craft store and Yamaha a music school.
A mall with shops to tender to ones needs. From sports equipment to groceries, it's all there. A large selection of restaurants and a food court with a good selection of hawker stalls.

Plaza Singapura is huge with many interesting shops and restaurants. However, not recommended if you are in a hurry and not familiar with it. There are no signages to help you locate a specific unit, and this means you have to walk every lane on the floor to locate it. The management could have easily made it more friendly by having directory signs on unit numbers. The escalators are set in such a way that you have to walk around nearly the full floor to get to the next one. If you are intending to just travel up or down the escalator just to get to your destination and not window shop- time is wasted with the extra walk. Customer Service counter is curiously placed on level 4 and behind the restaurants. Better naming of the building could help - for instance, there is Plaza Singapura Extension and I took me a long time to learn that it is the larger annex of the entire mall. Not even the shop assistants could help as they only know the place as Plaza Singapura. Overall, not a friendly place, unless you have a lot of time to stroll around.

Plaza Singapura is more a shoppingmall for Asian people i think. Its pretty big and not that crowdy. Alot of shops but more Asian brands, Chinese, Japanese,..As in every mall you have a movie theatre on top level and foodmarkets in the basement. There are quite some good restaurants in this mall when you like the real Asian food. In Orchard road so you cant miss it..
This shopping centre is the at the far end of Orchard Road and may be not so happening. But it houses a good variety of shops and also has a nice cinema.
An average size shopping centre located at the end of orchard road. Not a huge variety of things to buy. Comes with quite a lot of restaurants and cinemas.

This plaza was my fave out of all the malls in the Orchid rd area. Its a bit older but it doesnt matter as there is plenty of great shops. As a tourist i saw many shops here that i havent seen in Australia and that was a real treat. I especially loved Jelly Bunny (shoe shop). Lots of great food choices and the biggest collection of halal restaurants are here (around 14 i think).

The train station is joined and leads into and out of the mall which is really convenient. They have a Build A Bear Workshop too which i was glad to find. The top level has awesome gaming/toy shops.

REVIEW_TITLE: Overwhelmed with the variety and scale
REVIEW_BODY: I love this mall. So many affordable shops and eateries. It's nice to have dedicated mother'a nursing room and baby changing rooms. Super clean bathrooms and stores. If you don't mind buying non brand name items then this is totally THE place to shop. I spent 3 hrs and didn't cover 2 floors. The taxi line is quite long when the shops close at 10pm. Be prepared to wait.

REVIEW_TITLE: Get all your shopping done here
REVIEW_BODY: Although a bit older than the newer swankier places, Plaza Singapura, has almost all the shops you may want to go to. It also has a supermarket, all the fast food joints too. Give it a go.

REVIEW_TITLE: Good for finding more unique stores
REVIEW_BODY: As far as malls go its great for finding more unique shops in comparison to the usual, however does have an off layout
Not much to do or buy. For a tourist, it is not really a very exciting place to go to. It's also a bit secluded so you have to take a cab to go to and to get out of the area.
This is one of the many malls here.A good variety of shops.There lots of food outlets also.A good place to shop and eat.This is not that crowded.

The Property is situated right in the heart of the city victoria parkand is well connected free wifi system.There is an option of eating the breakfast this is especially nice during the winter months.Very Clean and Spacious room,Friendly and helpful staff.A very nice hyatt hotel.
The plaza is on exit of dhoby ghaut mrt so it is very easy to find this plaza. The plaza filled with many new restaurant and newest store brand.

Spacious restaurant if you are looking for pancakes, tea znc coffee. Food was very average and the waiter this overbearing, old lady who was not approachable at all. Not sure if she was just working there. Behaved like she owned the place.

Plaza Singapura was probably the largest mall we saw on Orchard road. Had two separate wings housed in two connected buildings, the Dhobi Ghaut MRT station is accessible internally. Lots of places to shop and dine at. There is a thrift store on top floor called Daiso, everything for 2 SGD, great for souvenir shopping. The food court on lower level is full of options, had a great Singapore Laksa here, can't recall the exact restaurant.

REVIEW_TITLE: Complicated to find a food court
REVIEW_BODY:
Entering from the entrance next to the MRT entrance, it was quite something to find a food court. Located at 6th floor on another building connected to the main one, we walked skme time around to find the right way. In the end I asked at information desk.
The food court have many various cuisine, but it doesn't hold a reataurant with Indian cuisine. Probably because Little India is too close, or maybe it just turn out like that. But it was a shame as I found the restaurants there too similar and I missed the diversity.

REVIEW_TITLE: If you haven't visited this lifestyle mall, you still not visit Singapore yet
REVIEW_BODY:
If anyone asks me to recommend a shopping mall in Singapore, Plaza Singapura will be on top of my head. Located at the heart of Orchard Road with Dhoby Ghaut MRT station inside, this shopping mall is well known with toys, action figures, cinemas, great food, great Cold Storage, comics, and home appliances. Popular fashion brands such as Giordano, Nike, G2000..... are there, with affordable prices with regular promotions.

I have visited Singapore for more than 10 times and every single time I always visit here. Good fun.

This place is just below Dhoby Gaut MRT station and it is very easy to be accessed as there are three different line trains you can take to go there. I came here with my friends to play Arcade games at Timezone which is located at level 7 of the building. There is also a cinema located at the same floor as the Arcade. There are also many eateries outlet where you can have your meal there.

not the best , not the latest or newest or interesting, but near to a lot of town attraction and near to Singapore management university hence it become of one it with combination of expensive and cheap food

This useful Plaza in Orchard Road, is convenientrly situated and very accessible. It caters for all tastes and budgets, including such stores as Marks and Spencer, Hamley Toys, first opened in Oxford Street in London in 1780, and a host of other shops, designer label or not, lots of restaurants, restrooms et al.

This is now quite a large mall, with an old and a new area. A wide selection of mid range eating choices scattered throughout the mall. It can get extremely busy at times and it's best to time your visit accordingly. Easily reached from the Dhoby Ghaut interchange station.

REVIEW_TITLE: So much to do in this mall.
REVIEW_BODY:
Plaza Singapura is the go-to place for my local friend and myself.

We often come here for a meal or movie or just to shop.

Today we went to an early evening movie at Golden Village - saw the Justice League - not too bad - the good guys won!

Afterwards we wandered around the shops - my friend likes to browse.

The main atrium is been decorated for Christmas - there were carols being played down on a lower floor.

This mall is handy to three MRT routes at Dhoby Ghaut interchange and local buses...easy to get to.

Well worth a visit when you are at this end of Orchard Rd

My friend and I went to Swensens (Plaza Singapura) and we actually wanted to have our breakfast there.

Knowing that we would only be seated after 11am, we did some window shopping at the shopping centre.

As I have some medical issues, prolong walking will cause alot of discomfort to my back and we decided to ask the manager if we could perhaps wait inside.

It was just 5 minutes to 11am, and the reply we got from the manager was a rude NO.

Enough said. No more Swensens for me.

Last time I was here two years ago this mall was a bit dowdy compared to many of the other Orchard Road malls but now it has been revamped and is a great place to visit.
With an excellent range of shops and regularly showcasing themed events, Plaza Singapura is fab.
The Kopitiam food court on the top floor has cuisine for all at a bargain price, Korean, Japanese, Thai, Vietnamese, whatever you like but gets really busy.
Clean, cool, safe, what's not to like!

It's a typical shopping mall under Capital mall group

You shd be able food that range from food court to higher end restaurants. Lots of fastfood restaurants. Western, Chinese, Indian and Malay food sure have something for you to eat. If love desserts there are pretty good not price still ok (can't compare to hawker centre that serve locals mostly of the time). Aircon and rental is not cheap in Singapore, so prices will include overhead cost.
It's great if you are like me hate to eat or shop under the hot weather.

There's cinema on the top floor for those who wanted to catch some movies in advance before neighbouring countries.

Some shopping brands in the mall like uniqlo (getting more exp), mark and spencer (U.K. Brand), fashion shops and a cold storage supermarket (located B2). Cold storage price is not cheap but freshness and quality better than some other brand supermarkets.
We went here on our first day in Singapore. My advice is save ya money and go and look elsewhere . Just a plain mall like others around Singapore .

REVIEW_TITLE: Busy Mall with Good Selection of Shops
REVIEW_BODY: This mall sits on top of the Dhoby Ghaut mrt station. It has a good selection of shops and restaurants. There's also a supermarket at the basement and a foodcourt at the sixth floor. The food choices are very wide and will suit a wide range of Budget and taste. Good spot to end in when you take a stroll along Orchard Road.

Personally think it's off Orchard. Having an MRT station right below is helpful. There are basic stores but it does not offer great variety. Especially lacks places to eat. The Dhoby Ghaut Station is right below, so it is well connected. A stop away from ION (Orchard station). Like to go to Plaza Singapura for errands usually as it's fast and not too crowded. There is a DAISO and a few great electronic stores.
Its probably one of the better options near orchard. Worth giving it a try as there are many shops around.
Plaza Singapura is the most convenient department store with the MRT interchange DOLBY GAUST inside. Good location to do the shopping and go to anywhere by MRT.
We went visit here one month go for buy something. Big mall and very nice. We are really love this place.

best best best for shopping....
complete shop electronics, household, hobby, music, and many more..
cant stop shopping when I came to this mall
a lot discount..
and if you a traveler also bought things over $100 SGD don't forget to get your tax refund..
happy shopping

REVIEW_TITLE: Everything you could want in a mall
REVIEW_BODY: We stayed about 5 minutes walk away at the YWCA Fort Canning. The mall had all the shops we could want. I shopped at all the places I don;t have close to my home like Daiso and Uniqlo. On the 6th floor is a very large food court with heaps of choices with very reasonable prices. Down in the basement was the usual fast food suspects and also a mosburger which was great. The supermarket also in the basement was handy for snacks and not paying convenience store prices. Right beside that a Japanese supermarket has opened with a great range. The mall also has a Tim Ho Wan which has michelin stars in Hong Kong. There was always a line of some sort but they do have a limited menu takeaway window.

REVIEW_TITLE: Looking forward to complete its renovation
REVIEW_BODY:
At the far end of Orchard Rd, Plaza Singapura guards the city's main artery with its multi-level building full of shops aimed at a variety of shoppers/diners. It houses popular global brands as well as local ones to make foreign and locals most comfortable. My friend showed me the new wing with its sleek look - a refreshing take on a cookie cutter mall. Currently there are renovations at both ends of every floor which is too bad as we missed out on our Costa Coffee date.
Entry is made more easy due to its conenction to MRT Dhoby Ghaut. Just follow the signs...fyi, it's quite a walk from train to store.

REVIEW_TITLE: Nice theather - waiting for the renovation accomplished
REVIEW_BODY:
The last time I was here, Me and friends enjoy a movie at this place. In general I always like this place. It only 5 min walking distance from dobby ghout MRT station, close by to orchard and sommerset.
At this moment the place was on renovation for some of its sections, the projects makes some disturbance and the closure disturb the panoramic view of the plaza.
Waiting for the mall back to its normal function on my next return to this place

An average shopping mall with the cookie cutter types of shops and eateries available.

Can be reached via the Dhoby Ghaut SMRT station. Some parts of the mall is being renovated at the moment.

Happen to meet friends for dinner at Xin Wang in the shopping centre.

Stayed close-by to Plaza Singapura during my recent visit to Singapore from 5th to 17th August.

My friend and I went to a movie on Sunday (14th) night at the Golden Village complex on the seventh level.

On Tuesday (17th) night we had dinner at Nam Nam Vietnamese restaurant on the first level then went to the U--Escape game venue for an hour (see separate review) - what fun.

After the game we went down to the food hall on the 6th level - so many food stalls to choose from - we had two dishes from the dessert stall - I enjoyed the durian ice dish. Very tasty.

I visited a few other times while transiting at Dhauby Ghaut SMRT station.

This is a good mid-sized mall with lots of mid-range stores that don't appear to have prices of the main high-end malls further along Orchard Road.

Next time I visit Singapore will definitely explore the 6th level food hall - I'm ready to go now!

REVIEW_TITLE: A bit out of the main stream....
REVIEW_BODY: A bit out of the way from mainstream orchard road...but you can the mrt from orchard if you need to go here. The mall itself is large and full of wonderful shops and restaurants...
Lots of interesting little shops and restaurants. Great bargains at John Little. There are many little cafes to chill and recharge for another round of shopping

On the way to The Istana, visited Plaza Singapura today. Nearest MRT is Dhoby Ghaut.

Huge mall with varieties such as restaurants, fastfood outlets, cafes, boutiques, book shops, furniture and interior design shops, beauty care shops, Golden Village cineplex, music school, telco shops, food court etc. Lack upmarket boutiques.

Can shop but do not expect much. Buy nothing.

REVIEW_TITLE: Mall at the heart Of Orchard Road
REVIEW_BODY: Second time around at SG and still i love to roam around at this mall. It is across Dhouby Ghat MRT thus highly accessible. Shopping and Eat you have it all at this mall.

REVIEW_TITLE: Good place to go see a movie
REVIEW_BODY: We go here regularly to see movies at the Golden Village. It's a good mall, the food court is nice, and some nice little restaurants on the bottom floors. If you want to escape the heat, you could do worse.

REVIEW_TITLE: Variety of restaurants and some shopping
REVIEW_BODY: I normally only go there for food. There is Tim Ho Wan, Ambush, One Market, Ichiban, Xin Wang HK cafe and many more. For fastfood - kfc, mc Donald's, Burger King etc. But for shopping not much, just 1 marks n spencer and Cold Storage supermarket. The rest are small shops. There is a Cineplex run by Golden village on level 7.

REVIEW_TITLE: My favorite shopping mall in singapore
REVIEW_BODY:
As a local, Plaza sing (which is what we call it locally) has everything I love, below is a list of food and shop to visit :
- Daiso (cheap and good $2 shop from japan)
- Emi cake (best durian cake I've eaten, so is their mango cake)
- Aussie burger, real LARGE burger, american style
- Llao Llao (healthy yogurt ice cream, always long queue) Ask for their best seller
- Nando chicken (spicy and yummy chicken meat on skewer)
- Cold storage (for you groceries, although expensive, it's got pork knuckles cooked and ready to eat, large sausages too)
- Kopitiam at 5th floor, I think, serves the best Ban Mien in singapore, my opinon
- Golden village (for movies)
- Starhub main service center (one stop all service mobile shop)
- Challenger (computer and accessories you need)
- spotlight and some artsy shop (for your children costume party)

The list goes on, but enough shop in a place for me to spend hours, instead of mall hopping.

REVIEW_TITLE: One of the better malls in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: Plaza Singapura is a great place for shopping, specially for creative things such as drawing, painting or house decoration since there are three great shops that maybe can not find elsewhere; Spotlight, Art Friend and Papermarket. The food court, Kopitiam is also nice, the korean and taiwan stalls are very good.
a pleasant place ... walk into this place from the MRT station near lucky plaza while enjoying a nice building all the way to here, because here too there is a MRT station .. interesting experience
